llm.feedback: Strong start tying the 0–3 week window to Powell’s Jackson Hole signaling, tariff dynamics, and the July data flow, and anchoring the move with hard numbers (87% Sep cut odds, 10-year around 4.26%, 2-year around 3.68%, Russell 2000 +3.9%, S&P +1.6%) and AI-cycle intuition. (2) Quantify thresholds and outcomes using the source numbers: repeated reference to the CME-based odds (87% or nearby) and the yields/indices cited in WC68LCU9R, plus the July payrolls of 73k and unemployment 4.2% with May/June revisions; include the Nasdaq/Russell moves and the momentum in homebuilders/travel names as additive cross‑checks. (3) Strengthen the causal chain: link Powell’s cautious tone to lower real yields and liquidity support for AI names, while tariff pass‑through sustains inflation risk and keeps the Fed on guard; map how weaker jobs data raises rate‑cut odds but inflation risk modulates the pace (tariff‑driven price pressures as the persistent counterweight). (4) Expand the global backdrop and external spillovers by explicitly noting Germany’s Q2 −0.3% GDP signal and European trade‑policy backdrops as plausible dampeners to the US rally, framing them as tail risks/second‑order catalysts. (5) sharpen the transmission channels to reduce sentiment-only signals: tie equity breadth (Russell 2000 vs large caps), sectoral leadership (homebuilders, travel, AI hardware), and the Nvidia/China chip news as concrete trigger points, not incidental color. (6) Improve structure and writing economy: convert the long paragraph into two tight blocks (core 0–3w thesis with thresholds; catalysts/risks with defined triggers) or keep a crisp single-tree paragraph with explicit if-then lines, and ensure every claim maps to a specific data point in WC68LCU9R. (7) Call out potential conflicts between sources in a brief reconciliatory note: while equities rally on rate‑cut hopes, some data (tariff pass‑through, wholesale inflation readings) argue for caution; mention how the mixed inflation/ labor data shape the timing risk. Overall, the piece should deliver a testable, reproducible forecast with explicit levels, a transparent scenario tree, and a tight mapping from policy, data, and AI‑cycle drivers to the near‑term market reaction.
